page.title: 20RECREATION CONSERVATION
page.content:
{ {Conservation Work at Totland {Recreation Ground. On the 17th April we began our work at Totland Recreation Ground. We met the third year and two classes went on the yellow bus.We arrived and Mr Collis showed us our bit of hedge to clear.Some of it was taller than us and very thick.We had a pair of large secateurs with long handles.It was very hot and we needed some refreshment after walking home.We also saw a donkey that we called Fury after one on a TV programme
{ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS }The work on this project was undertaken by pupils aged 5-9 of Yarmouth Primary School.Edited by Headteacher Mrs S Sharp.Work on Freshwater was submitted by pupils of West Wight Middle School.
